```{r units, echo=TRUE, eval=TRUE}
library(NISTunits)
```

Check code for Gibson $\alpha$ equation, where $\alpha = 1/\alpha^{*}$. Expect
that $\alpha > 1$ (i.e., L/V) because $\alpha^{*} < 1$ (i.e., V/L).
```{r setup, echo=TRUE, eval=TRUE}
# Gibson equation. ltmp in Kelvin, should yield alpha > 1
alpha_Gibson <- function(ltmp){
  alpha <- exp(-7.685e-3 + 6.7123/(ltmp) - 1666.4/(ltmp)^2 + 350410/(ltmp)^3)
  return(alpha)
}

# Input temps
ltmp   <- c(4, 11.9, 18.1, 22.2, 22.3, 18.1, 11.3, 6.0) # Krabbenhoft 1990 values
ltmp_K <- NISTdegCtOk(ltmp) # convert degC to Kelvin
ltmp_K # print out converted temps to check that it's actually Kelvin

# Calculated alpha
alpha  <- alpha_Gibson(ltmp_K)
alpha # print out calculated alpha values, expect alpha > 1
```
